node.statement: (T_psi* mu_0 ~ mu_0 by Cameron-Martin) The Cameron-Martin space of the massive GFF mu_0 with covariance C = (-Delta + m^2)^{-1} is the Sobolev space H^1(T^3) equipped with inner product <f,g>_{H^1} = <f, (-Delta+m^2) g>_{L^2}. Since psi in C^inf(T^3) and T^3 is a compact manifold without boundary, psi in H^s(T^3) for all s >= 0; in particular psi in H^1(T^3). By the Cameron-Martin theorem (Bogachev, Gaussian Measures, 1998, Theorem 2.6.4), the translation T_psi: phi -> phi + psi satisfies T_psi* mu_0 ~ mu_0 with Radon-Nikodym derivative d(T_psi* mu_0)/d(mu_0)(phi) = exp(<(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi>_{L^2} - (1/2)||psi||^2_{H^1}), which is mu_0-a.e. finite and strictly positive.
